job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: Have you ever wanted to build the fastest computer systems in the world? These days supercomputers are called "High Performance Computing Clusters" and they require ultra-high-speed networking hardware and software. Cornelis Networks' mission is to deliver innovative purpose-built interconnect solutions that enable our customers to optimally apply vast computational resources to create those clusters and solve the world’s toughest problems.Cornelis Networks is hiring talented software development engineer to help implement the APIs that applications will need to use these clusters. The bulk of the work will be focused around the interfacing our hardware to different open-source standard APIs such as Open MPI, and GPU software standards such as CUDA, and NCCL.Host Software ResponsibilitiesResponsible for maintaining and developing new features for both in-house and open-source APIs that allow customers to write applications for with use the Omni-Path fabricsAnalyze and develop technology solutions based on customer requirementsBuild and implement host software products to meet business demandsWork with Developers and Architects in developing host software configurations based on requirements.Identify and apply innovative technologies to update existing host softwareCreate and maintain documentation for host software installations, changes and upgradesTrain Junior Engineers on host software updates and new installationsCoordinate with vendors and support team on problem resolution, design issues and upgradesPerform troubleshooting, incident response, and patching in a timely mannerTroubleshoot and resolve technical problems in timely and accurate manner to improve application performance and functionalityEvaluate system architecture and make recommendations as requiredDevelop and implement standard processes for installation, maintenance and enhancement of host software applications Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s, Master’s, or Ph.D. degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline, or the equivalent in training and experienceExperience with networking software in the Linux kernel and extensive experience in C coding.Understanding of network protocols, TCP/IP, scalable algorithms and virtualization. Software development tools and scripting in a Linux environment, including git source control Preferred QualificationsDevelopment Bit Accurate and Transaction Accurate Modeling: experience in C++/SystemCExperience in one or more scripting language (TCL, Python, Perl, Shell-scripting)Experience with:InfiniBand or another HPC interconnectdeveloping and supporting open-source projectsOpen Fabrics Enterprise Distribution and upper-layer protocols such as IPoIB, SRP etckernel file system software including Lustre, NFSWireShark and network traffic analysisExcellent communication skills Preferred LocationCornelis Networks prefers key staff to be located at its Wayne, PA headquarters, but fully supports remote employees who are able to travel to our offices (when safe) periodically for in-person collaboration. Cornelis Networks is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.
